WorkItem.Description: I vs 2010 version grouping style "codebehind" don't work.

Comments.Message: Not sure what you mean by this? Can you give me an example?

Generate file is not show in children of source file.

View attach file (vs2008 version).

In code _projectItem.ProjectItems ==null in vs2010.

Awesome project!

I'm getting the same behaviour in VS2010

Essentially, when I create a .chirp.config file in vs2010, no code-behind files are generated.

I've tried changing the extension for config files in options->tools->chirpy but it exhibits the same behavior (i.e. nothing)

The other extensions DO properly kick in the T4 generation, I'm only seeing this behavior with the config file.

Work on project type : ASP.NET MVC 2 Web Application, ASP.NET Web Application ...
Don't work on project type :  ASP.NET Web Site

difference between Web-Site and Web-Application-Project : http://www.megasolutions.net/AspNet/difference-between-Web-Site-and-Web-Application-Project-27210.aspx

I can reproduce the problem if I use absolute paths in the config xml (i.e. /scripts/blahblah.min.js)
No error about not being able to use absolute paths and no t4 generation.
Workaround: Use relative paths

Thanks again for this great addin!
